channel.title: Occupied 4 times without immunity
channel.description:
#### What happened?
I was occupied four times in a row, without getting immunity. I was converted the night of #3.
#### What was SUPPOSED to happen?
I should have received immunity after #3, and should have retained it after conversion(?)
#### Steps to reproduce:
n1 occed n2 occed n3 occed, converted # should receive immunity, didn't n4 occed # should not have worked
#### Comments:
If the intention is for that clock to reset on conversion, that would be good to know as it would be potentially a major tell. However, I suspect that (like royal blood) it's supposed to be a personal attribute and not a class attribute at that point.

item.title: Occupied 4 times without immunity
item.dc:creator: geoelectric
item.description:
It’s not that, you get occ immunity after three times deb/occ/jailed. I’m saying I wasn’t granted that at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Occupied 4 times without immunity
item.dc:creator: Aurelia
item.description:
Isn’t there some class that can Break immunity? OR, In Are we just talking about some wierd glitch
@Ellie

Read full topic

item.title: Occupied 4 times without immunity
item.dc:creator: geoelectric
item.description:
It was yesterday, and I do wish I’d been able to save a game log to make sure, but I’m pretty sure it was a butler riding me.

I know there was a healthy debate as to whether he was sus for claiming 4th occ, and I was surprised enough to actually note it in my logs. I think a hh wouldn’t have surprised me. I also remember there was no “you are now occupy immune” message.

Read full topic

item.title: Occupied 4 times without immunity
item.dc:creator: Navi
item.description:
Just to confirm, the fourth occupation was not due to a drunk’s happy hour?

Read full topic

item.title: Occupied 4 times without immunity
item.dc:creator: geoelectric
item.description:
What happened?

I was occupied four times in a row, without getting immunity. I was converted the night of #3.

What was SUPPOSED to happen?

I should have received immunity after #3, and should have retained it after conversion(?)

Steps to reproduce:

n1 occed
n2 occed
n3 occed, converted # should receive immunity, didn’t
n4 occed # should not have worked

Comments:

If the intention is for that clock to reset on conversion, that would be good to know as it would be potentially a major tell. However, I suspect that (like royal blood) it’s supposed to be a personal attribute and not a class attribute at that point.

Read full topic
